021877164623373019988.description:
StudyTaco is a venture-backed EdTech startup revolutionising learning by
blending behavioural science, neuroscience, and gamification. Our mission is
to transform how students approach complex subjects, turning exam prep into an
engaging and effective experience. With a growing user base and two initial
games launched, we’re ready to scale and need a talented engineer to join our
founding team.

The Role

We’re seeking a Founding Engineer to take ownership of StudyTaco’s technical
vision and architecture. As a key founding team member, you’ll work closely
with the two co-founders—focused on product/operations and
growth/commercials—to design, build, and scale our gamified learning platform.
This is a hands-on role, ideal for someone with a passion for building
engaging, interactive products from the ground up.

Given our vision of gamifying learning, a background in game development or
experience creating engaging, interactive experiences is highly desirable.

What You’ll Do

\- Lead the end-to-end development of StudyTaco’s platform, including backend
architecture, front-end interfaces, and AI-driven features.
\- Integrate gamification and behavioural science into the product to create
seamless, engaging user experiences.
\- Ensure the platform is scalable and robust as we grow our user base.
\- Collaborate with the co-founders to align technical decisions with business
strategy and product goals.
\- Build and eventually mentor a world-class engineering team as the company
grows.

What We’re Looking For

Technical Skills

\- Proficiency in full-stack development (e.g., React, Node.js, Python, or
similar).
\- Experience with cloud infrastructure (AWS, GCP, or Azure).
\- Background in game development or gamification is a strong plus.
\- Familiarity with AI/ML integration and behavioural science concepts is
highly desirable.

Mindset

\- Passion for creating engaging, user-centered products.
\- Entrepreneurial spirit and a willingness to take ownership.
\- Thrives in a fast-paced, collaborative startup environment.

Experience

\- 3+ years in software engineering, ideally with experience in startups or
consumer-focused products.
\- Previous experience building or scaling a tech product is a big advantage.
021877164623373019988.title: Founding Engineer for Gamified EdTech Platform

021877148463587724222.description:
I am seeking a developer or automation specialist to build a system that:1. Parses incoming property leads (via email and/or SMS) to extract relevant
information (address, price, units, etc.).2. Queries RentCast (or a similar rent estimate service) to gather rental
data (current rent, rent comps, etc.).3. Populates a Google Sheet with key data (address, rent estimate, cash-on-
cash return, etc.).4. Handles special logic for multi-unit properties (7+ units) to store or
transform data differently.5. Keeps daily API costs to under $0.50/day.
---2. Project GoalsAutomation: Eliminate manual copy-pasting of property addresses, rent
estimates, and ROI calculations.Accuracy: Ensure data extracted and rent estimates are consistently accurate.Scalability & Cost Control: Handle a growing number of leads while staying
within a $0.50/day API budget.
---3. Scope and Requirements3.1. Data Capture & Parsing1. Sources: The system should capture data from:
Email: Some leads arrive via email (with property details or direct links to
listings).Text Messages (SMS): Some leads arrive via text, which may be forwarded
through services like Twilio or Zapier.2. Parsing Fields:
Address (required for RentCast lookup)Property Purchase Price (if available)Number of Units (important for 7+ unit logic)Any additional fields that might be relevant (e.g., link to the listing,
agent’s contact info, etc.).3. Preferred Tools (flexible):
Zapier, Make (Integromat), or a custom solution in Python/Node.js/Google Apps
Script.Must ensure reliability and easy maintainability.3.2. RentCast Integration1. Retrieve Rent Estimates:
Use RentCast’s API (or equivalent) to get current rent, high/low estimates, or
average rents for the ZIP code.If the property listing already contains the current rent, incorporate that
into the data.2. API Cost Constraints:
The system should not exceed $0.50/day in API usage.Minimize duplicates: Only call RentCast once per unique address.Potentially batch calls or check for repeated addresses.3.3. Google Sheets Integration1. Data Columns in Google Sheets should include (but aren’t limited to):
Timestamp (date the lead was processed)AddressPurchase PriceNumber of UnitsMonthly Rent EstimateOther rent comps or relevant data from RentCastCash-on-Cash Return (see next section)Notes or Status field for manual follow-up.2. Handling 7+ Units:
If Units less than 7, either:
Insert data into a separate tab (e.g., “7+ Units” tab), orEncode or summarize the data differently (e.g., partial data, redacted
financials).3.4. Cash-on-Cash Return Calculation1. Inputs:
Purchase Price (from the lead or manually estimated)Rent (from the listing and/or RentCast estimates)Down Payment (might be a standard % or a column in the sheet)Expenses (option to assume a percentage or a fixed amount)Mortgage Payment (if financed; can be estimated or left as a variable input)2. Formula:
Annual Net Cash Flow = (Monthly Rent – Monthly Expenses – Mortgage) × 12Total Cash Invested = Down Payment + Closing Costs (if applicable)Cash-on-Cash Return % = (Annual Net Cash Flow / Total Cash Invested) × 1003. Implementation:
Can be calculated within Google Sheets (preferred for easier tweaking of
assumptions).Alternatively, can be calculated in the automation script.3.5. Error Handling & Edge Cases1. Duplicate Addresses: If the same property address is sent multiple times,
ensure we do not duplicate RentCast calls unnecessarily.2. Missing Data: Some leads may be missing purchase price or unit count. The
system should log them but still attempt to fill whatever data is available.3. Notification/Logging: If a lead is processed successfully, optionally send
a notification (email or Slack) if it meets a certain ROI threshold
(optional).
---4. Technical Details & Constraints5. Platform/Hosting:
If using a no-code tool (Zapier, Make), you must specify the steps needed.If using a custom script (e.g., Google Apps Script or a serverless function),
it must be well-documented for future maintenance.6. User Authentication:
Securely handle the RentCast API key (do not store in plain text in public
code repositories).7. Daily API Budget:
Provide a method to track the number of calls to ensure we stay under
$0.50/day.Implement caching or a check on previously-seen addresses.8. Google Sheet Setup:
Must be able to handle 100+ properties without performance issues.Must accommodate dynamic columns for additional data or notes.
---5. Deliverables6. Fully Functional Automated Workflow
Demonstrates end-to-end process: from an example email/SMS to data populating
in Google Sheets with rent estimates and calculations.7. Configuration & Setup Guide
Instructions on how to set up or modify the API keys (RentCast, Twilio, etc.).Instructions on how to edit the Google Sheet formulas or columns.8. Source Code/Access
If code-based: Provide the script files or links to GitHub.If no-code: Provide screenshots or instructions for the Zapier/Make workflows.9. Testing & Validation
At least one test property address to confirm the system retrieves rent data,
calculates ROI, and handles the 7+ unit logic.10. Documentation
A short write-up on how to maintain and troubleshoot the system in case of
errors (e.g., API downtime, changes in email format).
---6. TimelineProposal Submission: Immediately upon job posting.Project Start: Within 1 week of awarding the job.MVP Completion: 1–2 weeks after project start (basic address parsing + rent
data retrieval + sheet entry).Final Delivery: 2–3 weeks after project start (include the ROI calculations,
7+ unit handling, thorough testing).
---7. BudgetOpen to proposals, with an emphasis on:
Minimizing monthly costs (aiming for $15/month total, including the RentCast
usage).Ensuring reliability of the automation.
---8. Selection Criteria9. Relevant Experience: Experience with property analysis, automating
email/SMS parsing, Google Sheets, or Zapier/Make.10. Portfolio/References: Previous work or references for similar automation
tasks.11. Solution Approach: Clear plan to keep API calls under $0.50/day, handle
duplicates, and maintain data integrity.12. Communication & Documentation: Ability to provide clear instructions and
maintenance guidance.
---9. How to Apply / Next StepsSubmit a brief proposal explaining:1. Your approach (Zapier? Custom script?)2. High-level architecture you envision3. Estimated timeline and costProvide examples or links to similar projects you’ve completed.Include the word “PropertyROI” in your response to confirm you’ve read the
details.
---Also want realtor interface to see scenarios and enter repairs or answer
missing quality questions about propertyBonus $15 if can like with offermarket us for ratesAI generated

021877139327902878654.description:
I used Replit, mainly its AI agent, to build and deploy a MERN web app via
Replit. I then created a marketing site for it using WordPress and managed
subscriptions with WooCommerce.

I set up user authentication for the web app to recognize users who have
created accounts on my WordPress site. I am using JWT authentification.

However, I'm having trouble getting it to identify whether they have purchased
a subscription and if it is active. The subscription plugin I am using is
SUBSCRIPTIONS FOR WOOCOMMERCE by WP Swings.

I need a developer to execute this implementation. I want to create a
marketing site where users can purchase subscription access and create an
account.

Then, we can identify if those users have an account and a subscription to the
web app. If they have a subscription, I would like to give them access to the
web app as long as it is active.

I know I used Tailwind CSS and maybe MUI. There are some errors and it would
be an added bonus if you can help fix them, but no worries if you can't.

Also, an added bonus if you have a lot of  WooCommerce and WP experience and
help clean up the checkout page on my website.

Please NOTE I am looking for someone who has DONE THIS BEFORE.
021877139327902878654.title: Need help to identify WooComerce subscription users on my Replit MERN web app
021877139327902878654.client_infomation: United States Coronado 5:53 PM $345 total spent 3 hires, 1 active

021877136828580039614.description:
Looking for experienced VAPI.ai developers who have worked with clients
already to build ai voice agents.  
  
MUST know how to make tools using Make or N8N (you will need to pick up N8N on
the job if you don't know it already but it's not hard).  
  
MUST know how to figure out APIs you have never experienced before (but you
have experienced quite a few already haven't you?)  
  
You must understand how to interact with GHL as well, via API.  
  
We have plenty of work.  Need you to work in US time zone during relatively
normal but flexible daytime hours.  
  
Will be able to work in a team although you'll have entire projects to work on
and will be expected to be able to complete them from start to finish based on
the specification.  
  
Must be scrappy and know how to figure it out using AI, searching, discord and
be able to operate on your own and get things done fast.  There's other people
to ask but you'll be expected to have done your research first.  
  
Must be able to deal with a little bit of task switching while we experience
rapid growth.  
  
Getting things done quickly and competently is expected.  
  
You'll give feedback on what you are doing by using a lot of loom and discord
to demonstrate what you have been working on.  
  
If you want to grow in this industry and get lots of real experience with
bigger clients, this is the way to do it.  
  
If the image attached scares you, this is probably not the job for you.
021877136828580039614.title: VAPI + N8N (or make)
